title: What is the relationship between hypnotism, magnetism, and somnambulism, and how have they been studied over time?
first_phrase: This last part of the text is a review and commentary on Dr. H. Beaunis' book, "Examen du Somnambulisme Provoqué," written by an author who is not named. The text discusses the use of terminology such as hypnotism and somnambulism and their proper classification in scientific terms. It also describes the history of the study of somnambulism and the different theories surrounding it. The author takes issue with the lack of recognition for their own contributions to the study of somnambulism and points out the inconsistencies in the public demonstrations of the phenomenon. The text ends with the conclusion that somnambulism and its related phenomena are still not fully understood and require further study.

Quand on essaie pour la première fois, je crois que le sujet peut toujours résister en ne se prêtant pas au procédé qu’on veut employer. Ainsi, le rire est un excellent moyen d’éviter le sommeil provoqué ; dès que la personne que vous voulez endormir se met à rire et tourne la chose en plaisanterie, vous pouvez cesser votre tentative, elle ne réussirait pas. Donc, l’affirmation de Braid et du Dr Bernheim est vraie, mais seulement pour ceux qui n’ont jamais été hypnotisés. Mais pour ceux qui l’ont déjà été, il n’en est plus de même. Il en est toujours un certain nombre (non pas tous évidemment, car il est des degrés dans la facilité à entrer en hypnotisme) qu’on peut endormir malgré eux.
last_phrase: In conclusion, while some authorities in the field have stated that no one can be hypnotized against their will, there is evidence to suggest that this is not entirely true. Individuals who have been previously hypnotized may be more susceptible to hypnosis and may struggle to resist the commands of the hypnotist. However, it is possible to protect oneself from unwanted hypnosis by suggesting to oneself that no one can hypnotize them for a specific period. While there are historical and contemporary debates surrounding the scientific validity of hypnosis, it is essential to approach the subject with caution and always keep in mind the potential risks involved.
